Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Preemptive \Pre*["e]mp"tive\, a. Of or pertaining to pre["e]mption; having power to pre["e]mpt; pre["e]mpting. [1913 Webster]
preemptive adj : designed or having the power to deter or prevent an anticipated situation or occurrence; "a preemptive business offer"
